A German Parliamentarians Assistance plan will be announced soon.
A Hong Kong Watch Trustee has accompanied Hong Kong Student Union leaders to Berlin. The first political refugee from Hong Kong, Ray Wong has also joined the students for a two-day visit to the Bundestag, the German Parliament.

This morning they have met with the Committee on Human Rights and Humanitarian Aid, including Dr Kohler Lukas MP FDP and Hedda Riedel Policy Adviser to Gyde Jensen MP FDP ( Chair). Also joining was Eckhard Gnodtke MP CDU, who came all the way from Luneburg, 4hrs away, and his policy advisor Gunther Von Mirback to join this meeting with HKIAD spokespersons Joey Siu, Sunny Cheung and representative Kex Leung. The meeting has covered many urgent issues in Hong Kong. A Parliamentarians Assistance plan on which Hong Kong Watch has been working will be announced soon.
